ygData.subject: Re: Owlhawk's training
ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: I prefer to think of them as humans in metal shells. Bic: Katya: Let us hope this works for me too. She enters the Chamber and enters a snoreful sleep.

OOC: I prefer to think of them as humans in metal shells.

Bic:

Katya: Let us hope this works for me too.

She enters the Chamber and enters a snoreful sleep.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> OOC: I think half-organic half-techno beings are
> called either androids or cyborgs.
> 
> BIC: Owlhawk:  The CR chamber I'll show you there.
> 
> He took her to the CR chamber.
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > OOC: That was a new approach!
> > 
> > BIC: Katya stopped inside when she reached two
> > corridors.
> > 
> > Katya: I am glad that you learn fast. For now,
> > though, we will put 
> > your education on hold. We should repair from our
> > fight... at least I 
> > should. After that, I think we should report for
> > duty. So... how and 
> > where do I take care of my wounds?
> > 
> > She still was not used to be a machine, and somehow,
> > it scared her a 
> > bit. She now shared a skin-deep - no, soul-deep bond
> > with her mech. 
> > It was extremely alien to her.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > Owlhawk:  Oh, makes since.
> > > 
> > > OOC: Considering I know nothing about Battletech
> > how
> > > was my guess?
> > > 
> > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Katya is taken aback by the answer. Of course,
> > she
> > > > couldn't expect him 
> > > > to know everything, but she did expect something
> > > > else.
> > > > 
> > > > Katya: Drawing first blood? Of course, it is an
> > > > approach that 
> > > > minimizes losses, but where is the fun in that?
> > We
> > > > might as well start 
> > > > using dishonorable artillery right away.
> > > > 
> > > > She enters the base before going on.
> > > > 
> > > > Katya: The bidding ritual is done in two parts.
> > > > Before a battle, we 
> > > > issue a batchall -a battle challenge- and ask
> > what
> > > > forces the defender 
> > > > will use. After that, two commanders bid against
> > > > each other to bring 
> > > > to least troops possible to achieve victory.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart
> > <dewboy30816@y...>
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > Owlhawk:  Each side agrees to send in a pre
> > set
> > > > either
> > > > > number or percent of warriors and they hold a
> > > > battle
> > > > > to the first damage rather than death to
> > determine
> > > > who
> > > > > goes and who stays.
> > > > > 
> > > > > He hoped his complete guess lucked out.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Katya was pleased. He seemed to catch things
> > up
> > > > > > pretty fast, which 
> > > > > > usually wasn't the case with even Inner
> > Sphere
> > > > > > warriors they'd 
> > > > > > captured.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Katya: Good! Let us continue then. The Clans
> > > > have
> > > > > > developped another 
> > > > > > system that minimizes losses and promotes
> > honor.
> > > > It
> > > > > > is our bidding 
> > > > > > ritual. Without any clue, can you guess what
> > it
> > > > is,
> > > > > > quineg?
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > >
